column1: Spain is the world's eighth-largest manufacturer of automobiles. Its car market stands among the largest in Europe. However
column2: this has not always been the case; in the first half of the 20th century
column3: Spain's economy was relatively underdeveloped compared to most other Western European countries and had a limited automobile market.  In this period
column4: car production was limited and only a few low-volume local manufacturers catered mainly to the luxury end of the market
column5: of which Hispano-Suiza was the most successful. Spain's limited market for mass-produced vehicles was taken over by foreign companies operating through subsidiaries that either imported cars or assembled cars from imported parts
column6: depriving the country of the technological know-how and large investments needed for mass production. The situation greatly deteriorated with the Spanish Civil War of 1936 to 1939. Car demand collapsed
column7: not only due to the greatly reduced purchasing power of Spaniards caused by war devastation
column8: but also because the multinational subsidiaries either ceased operations or were severely stricken by the war and its aftermath.

column1: 'Ecomotive' rangeAlmost every model in SEAT's range has an 'Ecomotive' derivative version
column2: which in comparison to the standard version has a more eco-friendly tuning.
low-resistance tyres
column3: new aerodynamics
column4: tweaks in the suspension
column5: as well as changes made to the engine's electronic management software with an additional implementation of a maintenance-free Diesel Particle Filter (DPF) for the diesel engines
column6: also updates in the gearbox and the gear ratios with a gearshift indicator in the dash panel reminding when it is the proper time to change gears
column7: combined with an engine 'Start/Stop system' and an 'Energy Recuperation system' are some of the modifications adopted in the Ecomotive range in order to cut down both fuel consumption and emissions. The result is a range with some of the cleanest models featuring an improvement not only in gas and particles emissions but also in fuel economy
column8: without big compromise in the vehicle's dynamic performance or practicality; for example the SEAT Ibiza Ecomotive 1.4 TDI has CO2 emissions coming up at 98 g/km and still it comes even faster from 0 to 100 km/h than the standard version featuring a 5-door body and air-conditioning
column9: while the SEAT León Ecomotive's CO2 emissions are among the lowest in its segment too and raise up to 99 g/km.

column2: the Ecomotive range has been renowned in many occasions.

the Ibiza Ecomotive has been declared on top of the Verkehrs-Club Deutschland's 2008/2009 list in the "environmentally beneficial vehicle" category and in the 10th Eco Tour not only it has won in the small diesel class but also proved to be the overall winner of all categories. In that specific year the SEAT Ibiza Ecomotive was also awarded with the 'Ecobest 2008' award by the Autobest organisation and the German newspaper Bild am Sonntag named it the 'most economic car of its class in the world'.

column1: The year 2009 has been the one when once more the Ibiza Ecomotive was nominated for the 'Green Steering wheel' award in Switzerland

column4: 910 km on a single tank.

column2: covering a factory area of 320
column3: 000 m2 with a system of more than 10 MW of photovoltaic panels. This installation is expected to produce more than 13 million kwh of electricity annually
column4: aimed at reducing greenhouse gas emissions by over 6
column5: 200 tonnes of CO2 per year.

column1: The 'SEAT Autometro' project comprises the construction and management of a rail link service between SEAT's Martorell complex and the Port of Barcelona
column2: in the aim of transport of vehicles and components.  Autometro is the joint-venture company which operates the rail
column3: having Ferrocarrils de la Generalitat de Catalunya (FGC) local rail company
column4: COMSA Rail Transport and Pecovasa as its shareholders.  The company was founded in November 2005 almost five months after an initial agreement was signed between the Catalan government (Generalitat)
column5: the Barcelona Port Authority and SEAT. Due to this project
column6: a branch connecting the Martorell plant with the FGC 'Llobregat-Anoia' main rail line had to be constructed
column7: as well as further adaptations to the transport network and the host infrastructures in the Port of Barcelona had to be made.  The budget for the project comes up to 6.8 million euro
column8: while SEAT on its part also assumes the operational transport costs.The use of this rail link since January 18
column10: instead of road transport
column11: has helped not only in terms of cost effectiveness and road safety but also in the reduction of both road congestion and greenhouse gas emissions.Over the whole 'Autometro' project awards have been given for the best logistics idea at the 2007 International Logistics Fair (SIL) and specifically to SEAT as the 2008 Distinguished loader by the Loaders' Association of the Port of Barcelona.
